favourite.article: Just woke up this morning filled with memories of how God sent His only Son to save us from eternal death. His name is surely tells what our God has in store for His obedient children. This suffering is but for a while, let's hold and trust in the Name, the name that all that have breath need to hear.

Thanks to those for work hard to put this hymn and many others on this site to bless the people of God. May God and Father of our Lord Jesus continue to multiply His grace upon you all. Amen. Keep up this good work.

I woke up this morning to with this song in my head thinking of my family who is with Him in heaven. I love so many of the old songs since I was raised with all of then. Thank you for letting me find so many on here. Love, Milea.
I woke up with this great hymn. it floods my innermost with peace. 1 John 4; 2 John 6
What a wonderful expression! I love Him and keep falling in love with Him each day.
Amen, He first loved us, & John 3:16.

Praise God!!! What a precious name Jesus is. The deaf hears the name of Jesus and start hearing, the dumb speaks, the blind see, the lame walk, the barren becomes fruitful, the sorrowful becomes joyful, the sinner becomes save, the saved soul becomes sanctified and the sanctified believers becomes filled with the Holy Ghost Power. Thank God for Jesus. Amen. Thanks for uploading this song and God bless you all.
Jesus, Shepherd of my soul, help me love You more.
I like the "plonky" approach, it makes it a lot easier to sing along when one isn't so sure about the tune.
Perhaps you could re-record with a more upbeat rendering like "I'm walking down the road"? Evelyn, please check out that piano part, really excellent. Tom.

I love the hymn but am sad the playing is so "plonky" rather than with beautiful chords and smooth in the style of Ted Smith of the Billy Graham Crusades. Many of the lovely older hymns on You tube tend to be plonky and make them sound childish.
Thank You Jesus for the finished work at Calvary.
I love this song so much. It reminds me of the love of the Lord for me and that He died to set me free. I love You Lord!!!

Hallelujah! Yeah, I love Jesus Christ, the Son of the Living God for having rescued me from the most dangerous and dark pit of sin where Satan, the devil, old serpent and who is also the dragon had chained me. My loving Christ and Saviour came to my rescue by atoning me with His own precious and priceless blood at the place called of the skull (Golgotha) where He redeemed me and broke all the shackles that had bound me, and He exclaimed, "Peter G. Mugoiyo, my friend, and to all the souls in the whole-wide world: IT IS FINISHED!" Glory to the Almighty Elohim, our most loving Father, and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ now and forever. Indeed, Jesus is the sinnerâ€™s perfect plea. Hallelujah!
Jesus l love You, l can listen to this song over and over again.
It's really refreshing the heart.

I can listen to this song host of times. It floods my innermost heart with joy, peace and happiness. It is a song that deeply settles within me. Waooo, I am always touched anytime I listen to it....Besides, it reminds me of those days as kids in Sunday School...

Ooh Praise the Lord Jesus for this wonderful song. It reminds me of the days, in the 80's, when my late mum will lead in their local church back in Western Kenya. Surely, I love to hear the name of JESUS because He died for me. Let us desire to hear this name. It is a strong tower under which the righteous run unto it and they are safe.

A good hymn. Love it .....written by Frederic Whitefield. 1 John 4: 19 We love Him because He first loved us. John 14:21 He that Hath my commandments; and keepeth them, he is that loveth me.......and a nugget to live by 2 John 1:6 And this is love, that we walk after his commandments. This is the commandment, That, as ye have heard from the beginning, ye should walk in it.
When I sing this song, it fills my heart with joy and crowds out any anxious thoughts. Really lifts my spirit!
I love this song because it reminds me of the day I got baptized. My heart floods with peace and joy when I listen to it.
I love this song so much... It was the first song I learned and it really touches me because it reminds me how much I love the lord!!
He died for me. What have I done for Him?
Yes, His precious blood - the sinner's perfect plea.
This song really touches me. It reminds us of how Christ loved us so much that he shed His blood for us..oh how I love Jesus!
